snippet: Anne Pringle, a Harvard mycologist, believes that lichens growing on a grave marker may help determine if immortality is biologically possible.
abstract: Harvard mycologist Dr Anne Pringle studies lichens in New England to determine if fungi actually decline with age; research on aging across organisms asserts that it is a biological imperative, but some scientists suggest that aging may not be inevitable and continue to pursue question of whether immortality may be biologically possible.
lead_paragraph: Anne Pringle, a Harvard mycologist, believes that lichens growing on a grave marker may help determine if immortality is biologically possible.

headline.seo: Studying Seemingly Immortal Lichens, in a Place for the Dead
headline.main: In a Place for the Dead, Studying a Seemingly Immortal Species
headline.print_headline: In a Place for the Dead, Studying a Seemingly Immortal Species
